title.native: 魔法のプリンセス ミンキーモモ

description:
Momo is a little girl who lives with her parents. She is from the land of dreams sent to earth to help people not lose their dreams. Momo and her parents own and run a hotel. Momo lives in Fenarinarsa which is near earth's space to help people who lost dreams. She uses her ability to change herself or something into various things.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Gigi and the Fountain of Youth

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Veterinarian
tags.description: Prominently features a veterinarian or one of the main characters is a veterinarian.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Tanks
tags.description: Prominently features the use of tanks or other armoured vehicles.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Fairy Tale
tags.description: This work tells a fairy tale, centers around fairy tales, or is based on a classic fairy tale.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Trains
tags.description: Prominently features trains.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Cowboys
tags.description: Features Western or Western-inspired cowboys.

tags.name: Tennis
tags.description: Centers around the sport of tennis.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

node.description:
[Wiki (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/芦田豊雄)

Toyoo Ashida was an anime character designer, animation director and director. He is the founder of the anime production studio Studio Live and as well as the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA) along with [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/).

He is also known under the pseudonyms Yutaka Ekoda (江古田豊) and Monta Ibu (伊武紋太).

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).
Masaru Umehara is a animation producer and planner.
Born in Dalian, Manchuria (then under Japanese occupation).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/藤山房伸)

The representative director of Jinnan Studio.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265852551)

Married to fellow animator [Noriko Morishima](https://anilist.co/staff/111797/).

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 1997) (2D Animation Assistance)
- Final Fantasy X (Video Game, 2001) (Storyboard Design)
- Final Fantasy XII (Videogame, 2006) (Storyboard)
- Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII (Video Game, 2007) (Continuity Design)
- Final Fantasy IV (Video Game, 2007) (Storyboard)
- Final Fantasy XIII (Video Game, 2009) (Storyboard Design)

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).

Originating from [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/), where he studied under [Ashida Toyoo](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/).

He made his debut as in-betweener on [Manga Nihon Emaki](https://anilist.co/anime/9856/) and became a key animator on [Cyborg 009](https://anilist.co/anime/4690/) but it was his work as animation director on the [Minky Momo](https://anilist.co/anime/518/) series that brought him recognition and he was asked to draw illustrations of Momo. Subsequently he became the character designer for the later OVAs.

In 1986 he made his debut as director on [Kyoushoku Soukou Guyver](https://anilist.co/anime/2293/). Following some more work as animator he switched to directing in the beginning of the '90s. He is nowadays affiliated with [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/).
